headline.main: The Eddie Van Halen of Paper Shredders

headline.main: After Report on Nepotism, State Courts Change Hiring Practices

headline.main: Should the U.S. Leave Afghanistan Now?

headline.main: Android Version of Instagram Gets 2,000 Signups a Minute

docs.snippet: Android users are clearly hungry for Instagram, the mobile photo-sharing app. The company behind Instagram released a version of its application for owners of Android devices, and they have been signing up at a rate of more than 2,000 people a min...
docs.abstract: Android users are clearly hungry for Instagram, the mobile photo-sharing app. The company behind Instagram released a version of its application for owners of Android devices, and they have been signing up at a rate of more than 2,000 people a minute, according to Kevin Systrom, the company's chief executive.

headline.main: Bar Owner Loved by Patrons, but Not by Broadcasting Service

docs.snippet: A Manhattan bar owner says neither he nor his customers should have to pay to watch sports that are broadcast free in Ireland....
docs.abstract: A Manhattan bar owner says neither he nor his customers should have to pay to watch sports that are broadcast free in Ireland.

headline.main: Tornadoes Tear Through Dallas-Fort Worth Area

docs.snippet: At least two huge tornadoes churned through the densely populated area on Tuesday afternoon, leveling homes and injuring at least a dozen people....

headline.main: Assad's Forces Record Brutal Crackdown as They Carry It Out

docs.snippet: Syrian activists working to show what the government crackdown on dissent looks like have found video clips apparently recorded as souvenirs by members of Mr. Assad's security forces....
docs.abstract: Syrian activists working to show what the government crackdown on dissent looks like have found video clips apparently recorded as souvenirs by members of Mr. Assad's security forces.
